Tonight at Lincoln Center in New York City, early-music expert Jordi Savall takes his audience to Jerusalem.
Savall has earned acclaim for resurrecting forgotten music from the Renaissance and the Baroque era, but this is different.

Jordi Savall says he doesn't believe in formal religion, but that there's something about Jerusalem the city endlessly destroyed and rebuilt by man in his quest for sacred power.
Even the topography in the rise of its stony hills calls forth the spiritual.
Jerusalem, it's a city that make you feeling you are very close to the heaven because the clouds, they are very close.
Because the city is in a high space, and you feel absolutely different than any other city in the world.
